This month marks 150 years since the birth of iconic American poet, Robert Frost. To celebrate his legacy, the Robert Frost Society and the San Diego Library Foundation are putting together the Robert Frost Sesquicentennial from March 20 to March 24. It will feature a mix of poetry readings, roundtables and workshops. Also, the San Diego Latino Film Festival returns for a 10-day celebration of Latino cinema, arts and culture. KPBS arts reporter and Cinema Junkie Beth Accomando sat down with the festival's new artistic director. And finally, KPBS/arts producer and editor Julia Dixon Evans covers all the arts events that should be on your radar this weekend, including a new photography exhibit in the San Diego Botanic Garden .
